It is characterized by its compact, cushion-like growth form and small, scale-like leaves that are typically less than 1 millimeter in length. This plant thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found on rocks or soil in temperate regions. Its reproductive structures include leafy shoots that produce spores, typical of liverworts. Brachysiphon microphyllus plays a role in soil stabilization and provides microhabitats for various small invertebrates.
